summary.span: 对包含文件或目录路径信息的 实例执行操作。

span.span: Performs operations on instances that contain file or directory path information.

summary.span: 这些操作是以跨平台的方式执行的。

span.span: These operations are performed in a cross-platform manner.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 路径是提供的文件或目录的位置的字符串。A path is a string that provides the location of a file or directory. 路径不一定指向磁盘; 上的位置例如，路径可能会映射到在内存中或在设备上的位置。A path does not necessarily point to a location on disk; for example, a path might map to a location in memory or on a device. 由当前平台确定路径的确切格式。The exact format of a path is determined by the current platform. 例如，在某些系统中，路径可以开始驱动器或卷字母开头，而此元素中不存在其他系统。For example, on some systems, a path can start with a drive or volume letter, while this element is not present in other systems. 在某些系统中，文件路径可以包含扩展插件，指示存储在文件中的信息类型。On some systems, file paths can contain extensions, which indicate the type of information stored in the file. 文件扩展名的格式与平台相关;例如，某些系统限制为三个字符，扩展和其他人不这样做。The format of a file name extension is platform-dependent; for example, some systems limit extensions to three characters, and others do not. 当前平台还确定的字符用于分隔路径的元素集和指定路径时，不能使用的字符集。The current platform also determines the set of characters used to separate the elements of a path, and the set of characters that cannot be used when specifying paths. 由于这些差异的字段`Path`类的某些成员的具体行为以及`Path`类是依赖于平台的。Because of these differences, the fields of the `Path` class as well as the exact behavior of some members of the `Path` class are platform-dependent. 路径可以包含绝对或相对的位置信息。A path can contain absolute or relative location information. 绝对路径完全指定的位置： 文件或目录可以唯一地标识而不考虑当前的位置。Absolute paths fully specify a location: the file or directory can be uniquely identified regardless of the current location. 相对路径指定部分的位置： 定位使用相对路径指定的文件时，当前的位置使用作为起始点。Relative paths specify a partial location: the current location is used as the starting point when locating a file specified with a relative path. 若要确定当前目录，请调用。To determine the current directory, call . .NET core 1.1 和更高版本和.NET Framework 4.6.2 及更高版本还支持对文件系统对象的是设备名称，如访问"\\？ \C:\"。.NET Core 1.1 and later versions and .NET Framework 4.6.2 and later versions also support access to file system objects that are device names, such as "\\?\C:\". Windows 上的文件路径格式的详细信息，请参阅[文件在 Windows 系统上的路径格式](~/docs/standard/io/file-path-formats.md)。For more information on file path formats on Windows, see [File path formats on Windows systems](~/docs/standard/io/file-path-formats.md). 大多数成员`Path`类不使用文件系统进行交互，且不验证是否存在指定的路径字符串的文件。Most members of the `Path` class do not interact with the file system and do not verify the existence of the file specified by a path string. `Path` 类成员的修改的路径字符串，如，文件系统中对文件的名称无效。`Path` class members that modify a path string, such as , have no effect on names of files in the file system. `Path` 成员将执行操作，但是，验证指定的路径字符串的内容并引发异常，如果该字符串包含无效的路径字符串中从返回的字符中定义的字符方法。`Path` members do, however, validate the contents of a specified path string, and throw an exception if the string contains characters that are not valid in path strings, as defined in the characters returned from the method. 例如，在基于 Windows 的桌面平台上无效路径字符可能包括引号 （"）、 小于 (\<)、 大于号 (>)、 竖线 (|)，退格符 (\b)、 null (\0) 和 Unicode 字符 16 到 18 和 20 到 25。For example, on Windows-based desktop platforms, invalid path characters might include quote ("), less than (\<), greater than (>), pipe (|), backspace (\b), null (\0), and Unicode characters 16 through 18 and 20 through 25. 成员`Path`类使您能够快速轻松地执行常见操作，例如确定文件扩展名是否属于某个路径，并将两个字符串组合成一个路径名称。The members of the `Path` class enable you to quickly and easily perform common operations such as determining whether a file name extension is part of a path, and combining two strings into one path name. 所有成员`Path`类是静态的因此可以无需具有路径的实例调用。All members of the `Path` class are static and can therefore be called without having an instance of a path. > [!NOTE] > 在接受路径作为输入字符串的成员，该路径必须是格式正确，或引发的异常。In members that accept a path as an input string, that path must be well-formed or an exception is raised. 例如，如果路径是完全限定名称，但以空格开头，在类的方法不修整路径。For example, if a path is fully qualified but begins with a space, the path is not trimmed in methods of the class. 因此，该路径的格式不正确，并且会引发的异常。Therefore, the path is malformed and an exception is raised. 同样的路径的组合不能完全限定两次。Similarly, a path or a combination of paths cannot be fully qualified twice. 例如，"c:\temp c:\windows"还会引发异常在大多数情况下。For example, "c:\temp c:\windows" also raises an exception in most cases. 请确保使用接受一个路径字符串的方法时您的路径的格式是否正确。Ensure that your paths are well-formed when using methods that accept a path string. 在接受一个路径的成员，路径可以引用的文件或只是一个目录。In members that accept a path, the path can refer to a file or just a directory. 指定的路径也可以指相对路径或服务器和共享名称的通用命名约定 (UNC) 路径。The specified path can also refer to a relative path or a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path for a server and share name. 例如，以下所有条件都可接受的路径：For example, all the following are acceptable paths: - "c:\\\MyDir\\\MyFile.txt"在 C# 或 Visual Basic 中的"c:\MyDir\MyFile.txt"。"c:\\\MyDir\\\MyFile.txt" in C#, or "c:\MyDir\MyFile.txt" in Visual Basic. - "c:\\\MyDir"在 C# 或 Visual Basic 中的"c:\MyDir"。"c:\\\MyDir" in C#, or "c:\MyDir" in Visual Basic. - "MyDir\\\MySubdir"在 C# 或 Visual Basic 中的"MyDir\MySubDir"。"MyDir\\\MySubdir" in C#, or "MyDir\MySubDir" in Visual Basic. - "\\\\\\\MyServer\\\MyShare"在 C# 中，或"\\\MyServer\MyShare"在 Visual Basic 中。"\\\\\\\MyServer\\\MyShare" in C#, or "\\\MyServer\MyShare" in Visual Basic. 因为对字符串执行所有这些操作时，就无法验证结果在所有方案中有效。Because all these operations are performed on strings, it is impossible to verify that the results are valid in all scenarios. 例如，方法分析将传递给它一个字符串，并从该字符串返回的扩展名。For example, the method parses a string that you pass to it and returns the extension from that string. 但是，这并不意味着在磁盘上存在具有该扩展名的文件。However, this does not mean that a file with that extension exists on the disk. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示了一些主要成员`Path`类。The following code example demonstrates some of the main members of the `Path` class. [!code-cpp[path class#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Path Class/CPP/path class.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[path class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Path Class/CS/path class.cs#1)] [!code-vb[path class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Path Class/VB/path class.vb#1)]

summary.span: 提供平台特定的替换字符，该替换字符用于在反映分层文件系统组织的路径字符串中分隔目录级别。

span.span: Provides a platform-specific alternate character used to separate directory levels in a path string that reflects a hierarchical file system organization.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在此字段中存储的字符不能在。The character stored in this field cannot be in . 此字段可以设置为相同的值。This field can be set to the same value as . `AltDirectorySeparatorChar` 和都是可用于分隔的路径字符串中的目录级别。`AltDirectorySeparatorChar` and are both valid for separating directory levels in a path string. 此字段的值为斜杠 （'/') 在 Windows、 UNIX 和 Macintosh 操作系统上。The value of this field is a slash ('/') on Windows, UNIX and Macintosh operating systems. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用`AltDirectorySeparatorChar`字段。The following code example demonstrates a use of the `AltDirectorySeparatorChar` field. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果既没有`path`也不`extension`包含句点 （.）、`ChangeExtension`添加句点。If neither `path` nor `extension` contains a period (.), `ChangeExtension` adds the period. `extension`参数可以包含多个句点和任何有效的路径字符，并且可以是任意长度。The `extension` parameter can contain multiple periods and any valid path characters, and can be any length. 如果`extension`是`null`，则返回的字符串包含的内容`path`与最后一个删除期间和之后的所有字符。If `extension` is `null`, the returned string contains the contents of `path` with the last period and all characters following it removed. 如果`extension`为空字符串，返回的路径字符串包含的内容`path`后到最后一个周期的所有字符中删除。If `extension` is an empty string, the returned path string contains the contents of `path` with any characters following the last period removed. 如果`path`不具有扩展名和`extension`不是`null`，则返回的字符串包含`path`跟`extension`。If `path` does not have an extension and `extension` is not `null`, the returned string contains `path` followed by `extension`. 如果`extension`不是`null`，并且不包含前导句点，则添加句点。If `extension` is not `null` and does not contain a leading period, the period is added. 如果`path`包含多个句点分隔的多个扩展插件返回的字符串包含的内容`path`与最后一个句点以及其后的所有字符替换为`extension`。If `path` contains a multiple extension separated by multiple periods, the returned string contains the contents of `path` with the last period and all characters following it replaced by `extension`. 例如，如果`path`是"\Dir1\examples\pathtests.csx.txt"和`extension`为"cs"，修改后的路径为"\Dir1\examples\pathtests.csx.cs"。For example, if `path` is "\Dir1\examples\pathtests.csx.txt" and `extension` is "cs", the modified path is "\Dir1\examples\pathtests.csx.cs". 不能验证返回的结果在所有方案中有效。It is not possible to verify that the returned results are valid in all scenarios. 例如，如果`path`为空，`extension`追加。For example, if `path` is empty, `extension` is appended. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用`ChangeExtension`方法。The following code example demonstrates a use of the `ChangeExtension` method. remarks.format: ## Remarks `paths` 应为要组合的路径部分的一组。`paths` should be an array of the parts of the path to combine. 如果其中一个后续路径的绝对路径，然后合并操作重置开头放弃所有以前的组合的路径的绝对路径。If the one of the subsequent paths is an absolute path, then the combine operation resets starting with that absolute path, discarding all previous combined paths. 组合路径中省略了长度为零的字符串。Zero-length strings are omitted from the combined path. 参数不进行分析，如果它们具有空白区域。The parameters are not parsed if they have white space. 对于目录和文件名称不是所有无效的字符被解释为不可接受的`Combine`方法，因为您可以将这些字符用于搜索通配符字符。Not all invalid characters for directory and file names are interpreted as unacceptable by the `Combine` method, because you can use these characters for search wildcard characters. 例如，虽然`Path.Combine("c:\\", "*.txt")`也可能是无效如果您打算从它创建一个文件，它是作为搜索字符串有效。For example, while `Path.Combine("c:\\", "*.txt")` might be invalid if you were to create a file from it, it is valid as a search string. 因此成功解释通过`Combine`方法。It is therefore successfully interpreted by the `Combine` method. ## Examples 下面的示例将一个字符串数组合并成一个路径。The following example combines an array of strings into a path. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`path1`不是驱动器引用 （即，"c:"或"d:"） 和定义中不会结束以有效分隔符， ，或，追加到`path1`在串联前。If `path1` is not a drive reference (that is, "C:" or "D:") and does not end with a valid separator character as defined in , , or , is appended to `path1` before concatenation. 如果`path2`不包括根 (例如，如果`path2`不以分隔符字符或指定驱动器)，结果将是两个路径，以允许插入分隔符的串联。If `path2` does not include a root (for example, if `path2` does not start with a separator character or a drive specification), the result is a concatenation of the two paths, with an intervening separator character. 如果`path2`包含一个根`path2`返回。If `path2` includes a root, `path2` is returned. 参数不进行分析，如果它们具有空白区域。The parameters are not parsed if they have white space. 因此，如果`path2`包括空格 (例如，"\file.txt")，方法将追加`path2`到`path1`而不是仅返回`path2`。Therefore, if `path2` includes white space (for example, " \file.txt "), the method appends `path2` to `path1` instead of returning only `path2`. 对于目录和文件名称不是所有无效的字符被解释为不可接受的`Combine`方法，因为您可以将这些字符用于搜索通配符字符。Not all invalid characters for directory and file names are interpreted as unacceptable by the `Combine` method, because you can use these characters for search wildcard characters. 例如，虽然`Path.Combine("c:\\", "*.txt")`也可能是无效如果您打算从它创建一个文件，它是作为搜索字符串有效。For example, while `Path.Combine("c:\\", "*.txt")` might be invalid if you were to create a file from it, it is valid as a search string. 因此成功解释通过`Combine`方法。It is therefore successfully interpreted by the `Combine` method. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示了如何使用`Combine`基于 Windows 的桌面平台上的方法。The following code example demonstrates using the `Combine` method on a Windows-based desktop platform. [!code-cpp[pathcombine#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/pathcombine/CPP/pathcombine.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[pathcombine#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/pathcombine/CS/pathcombine.cs#1)] [!code-vb[pathcombine#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/pathcombine/VB/pathcombine.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `path1` 应为绝对路径 (例如，"d:\archives"或"\\\archives\public")。`path1` should be an absolute path (for example, "d:\archives" or "\\\archives\public"). 如果`path2`或`path3`也是绝对路径，合并操作将放弃所有先前合并路径和重置为该绝对路径。If `path2` or `path3` is also an absolute path, the combine operation discards all previously combined paths and resets to that absolute path. 组合路径中省略了长度为零的字符串。Zero-length strings are omitted from the combined path. 如果`path1`不是驱动器引用 （即，"c:"或"d:"） 和定义中不会结束以有效分隔符， ，或，追加到`path1`在串联前。If `path1` is not a drive reference (that is, "C:" or "D:") and does not end with a valid separator character as defined in , , or , is appended to `path1` before concatenation. 如果`path2`不包括根 (例如，如果`path2`不以分隔符字符或指定驱动器)，结果将是两个路径，以允许插入分隔符的串联。If `path2` does not include a root (for example, if `path2` does not start with a separator character or a drive specification), the result is a concatenation of the two paths, with an intervening separator character. 如果`path2`包含一个根`path2`返回。If `path2` includes a root, `path2` is returned. 参数不进行分析，如果它们具有空白区域。The parameters are not parsed if they have white space. 因此，如果`path2`包括空格 (例如，"\file.txt")，方法将追加`path2`到`path1`。Therefore, if `path2` includes white space (for example, " \file.txt "), the method appends `path2` to `path1`. 对于目录和文件名称不是所有无效的字符被解释为不可接受的`Combine`方法，因为您可以将这些字符用于搜索通配符字符。Not all invalid characters for directory and file names are interpreted as unacceptable by the `Combine` method, because you can use these characters for search wildcard characters. 例如，虽然`Path.Combine("c:\\", "*.txt")`也可能是无效如果您打算从它创建一个文件，它是作为搜索字符串有效。For example, while `Path.Combine("c:\\", "*.txt")` might be invalid if you were to create a file from it, it is valid as a search string. 因此成功解释通过`Combine`方法。It is therefore successfully interpreted by the `Combine` method. ## Examples 下面的示例将三个路径合并。The following example combines three paths. remarks.format: ## Remarks 绝对路径包括所需的系统上查找文件或目录的所有信息。The absolute path includes all information required to locate a file or directory on a system. 指定目录的文件`path`不需要存在。The file or directory specified by `path` is not required to exist. 例如，如果 c:\temp\newdir 是当前目录，则调用`GetFullPath`文件名称，例如 test.txt 返回 c:\temp\newdir\test.txt。For example, if c:\temp\newdir is the current directory, calling `GetFullPath` on a file name such as test.txt returns c:\temp\newdir\test.txt. 不需要存在该文件。The file need not exist. 但是，如果`path`确实存在，调用方必须有权获取路径信息`path`。However, if `path` does exist, the caller must have permission to obtain path information for `path`. 请注意，与不同的大多数成员类，此方法访问文件系统。Note that unlike most members of the class, this method accesses the file system. 此方法使用当前目录和卷的当前信息进行完全限定`path`。This method uses current directory and current volume information to fully qualify `path`. 如果指定的文件命名为仅在`path`，`GetFullPath`返回当前目录的完全限定的路径。If you specify a file name only in `path`, `GetFullPath` returns the fully qualified path of the current directory. 如果您通过短文件名中，它将扩展为长文件名。If you pass in a short file name, it is expanded to a long file name. 如果路径不包含任何重要的字符无效，除非它包含一个或多个"。"字符后跟任意数目的空格，则它将分析为"。".."。If a path contains no significant characters it is invalid unless it contains one or more "." characters followed by any number of spaces, then it will be parsed as either "." or "..". .NET core 1.1 和更高版本和.NET Framework 4.6.2 及更高版本还支持包括设备名称，如下所述的路径"\\？ \C:\"。.NET Core 1.1 and later versions and .NET Framework 4.6.2 and later versions also support paths that include device names, such as "\\?\C:\". Windows 上的文件路径格式的详细信息，请参阅[文件在 Windows 系统上的路径格式](~/docs/standard/io/file-path-formats.md)。For more information on file path formats on Windows, see [File path formats on Windows systems](~/docs/standard/io/file-path-formats.md). 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示`GetFullPath`基于 Windows 的桌面平台上的方法。The following example demonstrates the `GetFullPath` method on a Windows-based desktop platform. span.span: Provides a platform-specific volume separator character.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此字段的值是冒号 （:） 在 Windows 和 Macintosh 和 UNIX 操作系统上的以斜杠 （/）。The value of this field is a colon (:) on Windows and Macintosh, and a slash (/) on UNIX operating systems. 这是最适用于分析路径，例如"c:\windows"或"MacVolume:System 文件夹"。This is most useful for parsing paths such as "c:\windows" or "MacVolume:System Folder". ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将`VolumeSeparatorChar`字段。The following code example demonstrates the use of the `VolumeSeparatorChar` field.
